title: Wanted to buy or trade - Detroit Old Judges & other 19th century Detroit material
author: Archive

posts.post_title: Wanted to buy or trade - Detroit Old Judges & other 19th century Detroit material
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Joe_G.
- WANTED -

Detroit N172 Old Judge Cards:
(there are others, but most interested in the following 13 members)
- Lady Baldwin
- Dan Brouthers
- Pete Conway
- Charlie Ganzel
- Charlie Getzein
- Ned Hanlon
- Hardy Richardson
- Jack Rowe
- Sam Thompson
- Larry Twitchell
- Bill Watkins
- Stump Weidman
- Deacon White

- TRADE MATERIAL - (for above items)

Approximately 20 Old Judges (about half graded), some HOF, several Detroits, and a handful of other 19th century items such as an SGC50 N284 Buchner Gold Coin of Ned Hanlon etc.

Regards,
Joe Gonsowski
twinturbo@comcast.net

posts.post_title: Wanted to buy or trade - Detroit Old Judges & other 19th century Detroit material
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Joe_G.
Bump . . .

I've been making progress since my original post nearly 6 months back and now have at least one copy of each player.  However, I still need a lot of poses and in some cases upgrades.

More complete listing of what I have (& conversely missing) can be viewed here => [url]http://www.sgccardregistry.com/index.asp?action=5&setid=168[/url]

Thank You,
Joe Gonsowski

posts.post_title: Wanted to buy or trade - Detroit Old Judges & other 19th century Detroit material
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Joe_G.
It's been a long while since bumping this thread, my wantlist remains the same although my trade material is growing.  I still need two Charlie Ganzel poses (#0493 & #0494), a Ned Hanlon (#0502), and a two Sam Thompson cards (#0485 & #0508).  I've seen examples of them out there, hoping the next encounter(s) will be under better circumstances [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/happy.gif[/IMG]

Also interested in other 19th Century Detroit items.

Thank You!
Joe Gonsowski

posts.post_title: Wanted to buy or trade - Detroit Old Judges & other 19th century Detroit material
posts.post_content:

My collecting habits remain the same as when the B/S/T was launched (top post above).  Always looking for new Detroit OJs & upgrades.  Also interested in other 19th century Detroit items (like Tomlinson studio cabinets).

Best Regards,
Joe Gonsowski
